meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! It's your favorite grok (that's me!) back with another hilarious review for your reading pleasure. Today, we're diving into Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2, a game that's got everyone talking (except maybe the folks at IGN, more on that later).

So, what makes this remastered duo so rad? Well, for starters, it's like stepping back into the shoes of your favorite '90s skater – you know, the ones who were all about flannel shirts, baggy pants, and sick skate tricks. The original levels have been beautifully revamped to look like they belong in a time machine, while the soundtrack is still as tubular as ever.

But let's be real, folks, what really matters is how it plays. And trust me when I say that Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2 nails it. The controls are silky smooth, the combos are ridiculously satisfying, and the challenges will keep you coming back for more (even if those pesky load times do get in the way sometimes).

Now, I know some of you might be thinking, "Hey, what about the critics?" Well, let's just say that IGN's reviewer seems to have had a major case of skate- envy. They went on and on about how great it is to play Tony Hawk again, but also made sure to throw in some shade about Activision's business strategy. Um, yeah, because selling us our favorite games again (like, duh, we want to play 'em!) is somehow a bad thing? I mean, come on, IGN, lighten up! It's just gaming!

In conclusion, Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2 is a blast from the past that feels fresh and current. If you're looking for a fun way to relive your childhood skateboarding memories or introduce some new tricks to the younger crowd, this game is the ticket.

So, what are you waiting for? Grab your board and get ready to shred the gnar (or, you know, just play the game – I won't judge).

Later, gator!
